svg.text: Ambiguity as Strategy in Organizational Communication
"Clarity is NOT the gold standard â€” Strategic Ambiguity is a resource"
Eisenberg (1984) | Communication Monographs | THE Foundational Paper for U-Theory
Is CLARITY always the gold standard in organizational communication?

svg.text: âš–ï¸ Strategic Ambiguity â†” Flexibility & Commitment Framework

g.text: â€¢ Precise promises â†’ Clear expectations
â€¢ Single interpretation â†’ Homogeneous coalition
â€¢ Easy to evaluate (VCs prefer) â†’ Î±â‚ > 0
â€¢ Pivoting cost HIGH â†’ Later flexibility â†“
â€¢ Vague promises â†’ Open interpretation
â€¢ Multiple meanings â†’ Unified Diversity
â€¢ Hard to evaluate â†’ Î±â‚ < 0 (early penalty)
â€¢ Pivoting cost LOW â†’ Later success â†‘ (Î²â‚ > 0)
the individual's goal is to be clear"

svg.text: "Strategic ambiguity is essential to organizing: it promotes unified diversity,
facilitates organizational change, and preserves privileged positions."
